intro: Draba alpicola, commonly known as the alpine whitlow, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its compact growth habit. The plant typically produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers in early spring. It thrives in alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Draba alpicola is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats at high altitudes.
